body: Please provide full DATA URI, because I think it is broken

We have a bunch of them in the output. On of the shortest:
```
data:image/gif;base64,
```
Here regexp https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/main/lib/schemes/DataUriPlugin.js#L14, but based on test, works fine...

I tried to reproduce this on a simple repo but with no luck. In our private repo I have at least three different mime cases that causes errors: data:image/svg+xml, data:image/gif;base64, data:font/ttf;base64. We got css-loader and mini-css-extract-plugin. I will try to narrow this down.
Yes, I can't reproduce too, do you have `file-loader`/`url-loader`/`svg-loader` or something same?
We have them in the legacy part of the codebase which does not causes this errors. In affected codebase `asset` is used.
I think somebody modify URL so I got this problem, I can't reproduce this problem even with broken data URI
@StreetStrider I stumbled upon the same issue. But after clearing the cache the error(s) went away.
@StreetStrider try to remove cache, maybe you have corrupted cache, anyway I can't reproduce, closing, feel free to feedback
@pataar it went away because it occurs only on cache. When I first run my build there's no error, on the second run I got multiple deserialization issues.
@StreetStrider it means some of your plugins break webpack cache

@alexander-akait what is the best way to debug a sequence of loaders working? I think to tap into webpack's node_modules code but don't know where to start. Can you point out the place where should I start to look?
@StreetStrider Can you provide cache options an list of plugins?
